dalserver
Class RangeList

java.lang.Object
  dalserver.RangeList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Range>
public class RangeList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Range>

The RangeList class implements a multi-element, numeric or string, ordered or unordered range list object.

Method Detail

parseRangeList

public int parseRangeList(java.lang.String ranges)
                   throws DalServerException
Parse a range list string and add the ranges therein to an existing range list. May be called multiple times to add successive groups of ranges to a single compiled range list object. In the case of a nonnumeric range list, the string tokens may not contain any of the delimiter metacharacters ',' ';' or '/'. Returns a count of the number of items (ranges or properties) processed.

Parameters:
ranges - The encoded range-list string.
Throws:
DalServerException - Numeric and nonnumeric are mixed together.

Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Range>

getRange

public Range getRange(int index)
               throws DalServerException
Convenience routine to get a single Range element. This should only be used for small values of the index, to avoid repeatedly traversing the list (use an iterator to step through the entire list).

Parameters:
index - The list element to be returned, e.g., 0 or 1.
Throws:
DalServerException - Throws a DALServerException if the referenced range element does not exist.

stringValue

public java.lang.String stringValue(int index)
                             throws DalServerException
Convenience routine to get the value of a a single-valued Range element as a String. Use only for simple single-valued lists.

Throws:
DalServerException
